reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Brazil - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: REFLORA- KEW capacity building programme

description.narrative: Capacity building of researchers and development of a Brazilian national collection of native plant species

To build capacity and resources to support Brazilian researchers to capture of economic and social benefit from Brazil’s diverse flora. Targets: 150 visitor weeks (Brazilian researchers at Kew) and 80,000 images of specimens transferred to Rio de Janeiro Botanic Garden
Reflora has the overall objective of making a significant contribution to the scientific and technological development of Brazil by means of researching, retrieving and using herbarium and archive information and making this information available by means of the authenticated Virtual Herbarium of the Brazilian Flora. Reflora includes the plants collected in Brazil and deposited in the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and this project includes the digitisation of these specimens but also a comprehensive capacity building programme for visiting Brazilian scholars. This includes training in digitisation techniques, analysis of the collections, paper preparation for publication in peer-reviewed journals, research proposal development, and technical support for data capture and interpretation. This will be critically important for the effective and sustainable capture of economic and social benefit from Brazil’s diverse flora, and will go beyond the production of high-quality academic research, with benefits for national environmental policy, the economy and management of resources.

title.narrative: Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics Education

description.narrative: Capacity building for university professors with proven record of applied work in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics subjects teaching in public schools

To build capacity and resources to support Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics education professors to engage with new experiences in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics subject teaching and disseminate new methodologies within the Brazilian public school syScience, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics. Targets: 15 university professors in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics immersion programme in the UK and 15 public schools engaged in debating, applying lessons learned and joint solutions in the first year

title.narrative: Professional Development - Clinics

description.narrative: Supporting capacity training and capacity bulding for public health professionals working with therapeutic treatment for vicitms of state violence

To train and increase capacity of a cohort of professionals in public health, capable to effectively work with psychoanalysis and therapeutic technics and address the needs of Black and peripheral populations recurrently victims of violence; to promote the exchange of knowledge in the field of public health, psychology; to creat a strong nucleous of bilateral colaboration to create the reference network for public health professions working with psychological with the potential to impact up to 600000 health professionals

title.narrative: Professional development - MSc For Underrepresented groups in Science - Call March 2017

description.narrative: Professional Master Degree for Underrepresented groups in science, with objectives of social inclusion, diversity in Higher Education UK institutions and a stronger science and innovation ecosystem in the partner countries.

Supporting students who will complete a degree in the UK and then go on to promote Science as a career choice for individuals from marginalised communities. The evaluation process for this opportunity will run beyond the end of the degree and capture the activities of the students post award.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional Development

description.narrative: Provide creative economy enterprise training in low income areas in periphery of São Paulo. Pilot project will train 50 agents and to replicate to 100 enterpreneurs.

The project will promote skills and professional development in creative economy enterprise to generate business and technology development through innovation as a way of raising social development and reducing economic inequalities among young populations living in outlying areas of low-incomes that usually are not included in this agenda. The focus of the pilot in the public sector sector, and the target is to train 50 agents, and to replicate to 100 enterpreneurs in periphery of São Paulo. It will follow the current policy of decentralize training to impact peripheral areas. Study of the town hall, which is foregrounding the project, is attached.

description.narrative: Promote staff exchanges and proliferation of science through community engagement desgined by science museums nation-wide

To promote community engagement with science museum programmes, especially in areas with high potential of gentrification. Focus of the programme on poor and peripheral areas and public schools.

title.narrative: ZICA Institutional Links

description.narrative: Launch a multi-partner call on Zica, targetting its social impacts through training, research and instititional development, responding to in - country priorities.

Produce relevant applied research to respond to Zika´s social impacts by generating training courses, improved protocols, stronger networks and collaborative platforms for learining and prevention of further impacs. Stiluate the construction of networks across 5 FAPS (research foundations from the states of Pernambuco, Ceará, Distrito Federal, Paraíba e Alagoas) and the Fundaçao Oswaldo Cruz from the Ministry of Health.

title.narrative: Institutional Links June 2019

description.narrative: Institutional Links on Impact and Evidence-based Policies 2019. Call launch with FGV and Fiocruz.

Support the development and consolidate networks of researchers in the UK and Brazil, favouring an interdisciplinary approach that will use the collection and systematisation of data together with the extensive research on these diseases to create and implement public health methodologies, indicators, and database that will inform, monitor and evaluate public health policies.
